items.title: Trump Administration Acts to ‘Severely Weaken’ a Key Environmental Law
items.description: The Trump administration began this week to radically alter how the National Environmental Policy Act is implemented across the federal government, alarming environmentalists.  Passed in 1970 and often called the “Magna Carta” of U.S. environmental law, NEPA requires agencies to assess the environmental impacts of their actions during the decision-making process.
